Posted By: Jayquaz (6/19/2012 10:31:02 AM)

posts.post_content: Sundial of the infinite causes you to skip your end step, but you would still need to sacrifice him your next turn. You'd have to keep using the sundial to keep him around. Ruling: "The creature is sacrificed at the end of every turn in which it is on the battlefield. There is no choice about what turn to sacrifice it."
posts.html:
Sundial of the infinite causes you to skip your end step, but you would still need to sacrifice him your next turn. You'd have to keep using the sundial to keep him around. Ruling: "The creature is sacrificed at the end of every turn in which it is on the battlefield. There is no choice about what turn to sacrifice it."

posts.post_content:
Just an idea of a mechanic that I thought of that could make this an uncommon, or even a common:  
  
Unstable *(Unless this spell is on the top of the stack, it is countered.)*  
  
Another idea that could make this cost a lot less mana, though make this a lot more risky:  
  
Treachery *(Whenever this creature attacks and is not blocked, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, it deals combat damage to you instead)*
posts.html:
Just an idea of a mechanic that I thought of that could make this an uncommon, or even a common:

Unstable (Unless this spell is on the top of the stack, it is countered.)

Another idea that could make this cost a lot less mana, though make this a lot more risky:

Treachery (Whenever this creature attacks and is not blocked, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, it deals combat damage to you instead)
